answerText: Boris Pasternak[10] Pasternak also wrote this novel about a physician in love with Lara Antipov.
heading: NASAT |2013 | 9 | 8 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This poet wrote that the clocks ticking does not trouble happy people, concluding, "sleep, it seems, is all this couple is up to," in his poem "In the Woods." For 10 points each: [10] Name this poet of the collections My Sister, Life and On Early Trains. The title character concludes that "to live a life is not to cross a field" in his poem "Hamlet."
